noa.name: Northwest Argentina Experience
noa.summary: Explore the colorful mountains and rich cultural heritage of Salta and Jujuy
noa.description: Immerse yourself in the breathtaking landscapes of Argentina's northwest region. From the multicolored mountains of Purmamarca to the sprawling white salt flats of Salinas Grandes, this 8-day journey takes you through ancient indigenous cultures, colonial cities, and some of South America's most stunning natural wonders. Experience world-class high-altitude wines in Cafayate and walk through UNESCO World Heritage sites.
noa.inquiryText: Hello! I'm interested in learning more about the Northwest Argentina Experience module. Could you provide additional details about availability and pricing?

buenosaires.name: Buenos Aires Cultural Immersion
buenosaires.summary: Discover the Paris of South America - tango, architecture, and gastronomy
buenosaires.description: Experience the vibrant energy of Buenos Aires, a city where European elegance meets Latin American passion. This 5-day cultural immersion will take you through historic neighborhoods like San Telmo and La Boca, where tango was born. Enjoy world-class steaks and Malbec wine, explore stunning French-inspired architecture in Recoleta, and experience the nightlife in trendy Palermo. This is Argentina's cosmopolitan heart.
buenosaires.inquiryText: Hello! I'd like to know more about the Buenos Aires Cultural Immersion module. What dates are available and what's included in the package?

patagonia.name: Patagonia Adventure
patagonia.summary: Journey to the end of the world - glaciers, mountains, and untamed nature
patagonia.description: Venture into one of the planet's last true wilderness areas. This 10-day Patagonia adventure takes you from the awe-inspiring Perito Moreno Glacier to the rugged peaks of El Chaltén, south to the world's southernmost city of Ushuaia, and north to the pristine lakes and forests of Bariloche. Experience nature at its most dramatic, with opportunities for hiking, wildlife viewing, and unforgettable landscapes that will stay with you forever.
patagonia.inquiryText: Hello! I'm very interested in the Patagonia Adventure module. Can you share more information about the itinerary, difficulty level, and what's included?

day1.title: Arrival in Salta
day1.description: Arrive in Salta, transfer to hotel. Evening orientation and welcome dinner featuring regional cuisine.

day2.title: Salta City Tour
day2.description: Explore colonial architecture, historic plazas, and local markets. Visit San Francisco Church and MAAM museum.

day3.title: Cafayate & Wine Route
day3.description: Journey through Quebrada de las Conchas. Wine tasting at high-altitude vineyards in Cafayate.

day4.title: Cachi & Los Cardones
day4.description: Drive through Cuesta del Obispo and Los Cardones National Park. Visit the charming town of Cachi.

day5.title: Purmamarca & Seven Colors Mountain
day5.description: Travel to Jujuy. Visit the iconic Cerro de los Siete Colores and explore Purmamarca's artisan market.

day6.title: Quebrada de Humahuaca
day6.description: Full day exploring UNESCO World Heritage valley. Visit Tilcara, Humahuaca, and indigenous communities.

day7.title: Salinas Grandes
day7.description: Journey to the vast white salt flats. Photography opportunities and learn about salt extraction.

day8.title: Departure
day8.description: Transfer to airport. Departure with unforgettable memories of Argentina's northwest.

day1.title: Arrival & City Introduction
day1.description: Arrive in Buenos Aires, transfer to hotel in Recoleta. Evening orientation walk and dinner.

day2.title: Historic Buenos Aires
day2.description: Guided tour of Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Metropolitan Cathedral. Afternoon in San Telmo's antique markets.

day3.title: La Boca & Tango
day3.description: Morning visit to colorful Caminito. Afternoon tango lesson. Evening professional tango show with dinner.

day4.title: Recoleta & Palermo
day4.description: Visit Recoleta Cemetery and cultural center. Explore Palermo's parks, boutiques, and trendy restaurants.

day5.title: Departure
day5.description: Free morning for shopping or final explorations. Transfer to airport.

day1.title: Arrival in El Calafate
day1.description: Arrive in El Calafate, gateway to the glaciers. Hotel check-in and orientation.

day2.title: Perito Moreno Glacier
day2.description: Full day at Perito Moreno Glacier. Walking the viewing platforms and optional ice trekking.

day3.title: Transfer to El Chaltén
day3.description: Scenic drive to El Chaltén. Afternoon short hike with views of Fitz Roy.

day4.title: Fitz Roy Trek
day4.description: Full day trekking to Laguna de los Tres with stunning views of Mount Fitz Roy.

day5.title: Fly to Ushuaia
day5.description: Morning flight to Ushuaia. Afternoon city tour of the world's southernmost city.

day6.title: Tierra del Fuego National Park
day6.description: Explore Tierra del Fuego National Park by land and sea. End of the world train ride.

day7.title: Beagle Channel Cruise
day7.description: Boat tour of Beagle Channel. Visit sea lion colonies and penguin islands.

day8.title: Fly to Bariloche
day8.description: Flight to Bariloche. Check into hotel in this Swiss-style mountain town.

day9.title: Circuito Chico
day9.description: Explore the small circuit around Nahuel Huapi Lake. Visit viewpoints, beaches, and chocolate shops.

day10.title: Departure
day10.description: Free morning. Transfer to airport for departure.

about.title: Born and raised in Argentina
about.description: I am the founder of Gates to Argentina, a boutique agency born from a solid international background. For over 15 years, I led tour operations in the Middle East through Gates to Israel, managing more than 500 groups and perfecting the art of travel logistics. Our firm is distinguished by offering trilingual service (Spanish, English, and Hebrew) and 24/7 support, ensuring that every detail of your trip is covered. Although our original headquarters were in Israel, today we operate with offices in Tucumán, New York, and Israel, building bridges between continents. My role has always been one of 'courage and logistics.' After returning to Argentina in 2023, I apply that same rigor and passion to designing personalized programs that combine adventure, culture, and comfort in one of South America's most fascinating countries.
